duties_responsibilities.duty: Fabricate, modify, install, troubleshoot, repair, and maintain ground, airborne, and electronic equipment such as unmanned aerial vehicles, ground control stations, and ground support equipment.
Operate UAV, ground control stations and ground support equipment at assigned location.
Construct individual components of electronic equipment following detailed schematics, layout diagrams, and work instructions.
Correct minor discrepancies by removal, repair, or replacement of defective or deleted parts of aircraft electrical systems.
Perform limited functional checks on existing and newly installed aircraft electrical systems and equipment.
Operate automatic test equipment to locate, diagnose, and repair defective parts.
Represent group with team leaders, supply personnel, A&P mechanics, pilots and internal and external customers.

Responsible for observing all laws, regulations and other applicable obligations wherever and whenever business is conducted on behalf of the Company. Expected to work in a safe manner in accordance with established operating procedures and practices.
Additional Functions Other duties as assigned or required.

education_certification.credential: Associate's degree in Electronics, Aviation Technology, or a related field (Bachelor's preferred)
